titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Raymond Singley Communications Workers of America, Local 1060 Collection WAG.310

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-12-11 11:13:47 -0500.

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

did.unittitle: Raymond Singley Communications Workers of America, Local 1060 Collection

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: CWA Local 1060 represents workers at Lucent (formerly Bell Labs, in Murray Hill, NJ). This collection consists of material compiled by Raymond A. Singley (1920-2005), who served as a local steward and executive board member. The collection includes minutes, reports, stewards manuals, bargaining and grievance materials, and CWA memorabilia.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by Dawn Zetto, 2010. The accession number associated with this gift is 2010.006.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Raymond Singley Communications Workers of America, Local 1060 Collection; WAG 310; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright (or related rights to publicity and privacy) for materials in this collection, created by Raymond Singley was not transferred to New York University. Permission to use materials must be secured from the copyright holder.

controlaccess.corpname: Communications Workers of America. Local 1060 (North Plainfield, N.J.)
